de.tuberlin.dima.bdapro.advancedProcessing.featureTable

Class FeatureTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tuberlin.dima.bdapro.advancedProcessing.featureTable.FeatureTable

  • public class FeatureTable
extends java.lang.Object
    The feature table is the core abstraction in the data processing component. It encapsulates all necessary data and metadata to create an intermediate dataset that contains all key columns and all feature columns.

    Feature tables can be joined by specifying a join predicate and referring to columns to their full names. The full names should not change in nested joins when using Column.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FeatureTable

        public FeatureTable(java.lang.String name,
                    org.apache.flink.table.api.Table data,
                    java.util.List<? extends Column> columns,
                    java.util.List<? extends Column> keyColumns,
                    org.apache.flink.table.api.TableEnvironment tableEnvironment)
        Creates a new feature table from the given data and metadata.

        To allow for easy joining of the feature tables, the columns are renamed to _.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the feature table.
        data - A Flink Table containing all relevant data for the feature table.
        columns - The relevant columns of the feature table.
        keyColumns - The columns forming a row key.
        tableEnvironment - The TableEnvironment in which the feature table shall be registered.

      • FeatureTable

        private FeatureTable(FeatureTable tableOne,
                     FeatureTable tableTwo,
                     java.util.List<? extends Column> keyColumns,
                     java.lang.String joinPredicate,
                     org.apache.flink.table.api.BatchTableEnvironment batchTableEnvironment)
        Creates a new feature table by joining two existing ones.
        Parameters:
        tableOne - The first table to join.
        tableTwo - The second table to join.
        keyColumns - The columns forming a row key for the joined feature table.
        joinPredicate - The join predicate defining how to join the tables.
        batchTableEnvironment - The table environment in which the feature tables are registered.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this feature table.

      • write

        public void write(org.apache.flink.core.fs.Path outputPath,
                  org.apache.flink.table.api.TableEnvironment tEnv)
        Writes the key and feature columns of the feature table to a file in the given output path separated by a semicolon. If the file already exists, it is overwritten.
        Parameters:
        outputPath - The file path of the output file including the full filename.
        tEnv - The table environment to use.

      • join

        Creates a new feature table by joining the current table with another one.
        Parameters:
        tableTwo - The table to join with.
        keyColumns - The columns forming a row key for the joined feature table.
        joinPredicate - The join predicate defining how to join the tables.
        batchTableEnvironment - The table environment in which the feature tables are registered.
